page.title: 14BAYSGARTH SWIMMING POOL
page.content:
Barton's first pool was an open air pool. It had a main pool and a separate paddling area surrounded by a spectating area. In 1981 this pool was closed. It was going to be changed into an up to date pool.
The new pool was to look like a Spanish beach setting. It was opened in 1984. It has a palm tree and sun lights. The palm tree was transported across from Spain and cost Â£2000. There is an area for spectators where they can sit at parasolled tables and watch their kiddies have fun in the pool.
In addition to open public sessions, the pool is available for use by schools, adult education classes and local clubs and organisations.
